(High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Argument Parsing] Can oversized or malformed command-line arguments cause Args::parse() to panic or consume excessive memory, leading to denial-of-service before the logger is even initialized? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Logger Initialization] Can an attacker exploit the timing window between program start and logger initialization (lines 23-27) to perform malicious actions without any audit trail being created? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Log Level Security] Does hardcoding the log level to Info at line 26 prevent critical security events from being logged at Debug level, potentially hiding attack patterns or security violations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Log Configuration] Can the Logger::builder() configuration be manipulated by environment variables or other external inputs to redirect logs to attacker-controlled destinations or disable logging entirely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: main()] [Async Context] Does the #[tokio::main] macro create a single-threaded or multi-threaded runtime by default, and could the wrong runtime configuration lead to race conditions or deadlocks in the underlying Server implementation? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/service/src/main.rs] [Function: run_command()] [Cancellation Safety] If the async run_command() is cancelled or times out, are there any cleanup operations that fail to execute, potentially leaving the faucet service in an unsafe state with uncommitted transactions?
